intro: Mesembryanthemum delum, commonly known as the rockrose, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers, which appear in the evening, come in a range of colors including pink, yellow, and white. Mesembryanthemum delum is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
